sense.gloss: (getting into the) mood, (entering into the) spirit, energy, enthusiasm, rhythm, feeling
to get on (train, plane, bus, ship, etc.), to get in, to board, to take, to embark
to get on (e.g. a footstool), to step on, to jump on, to sit on, to mount
to reach, to go over, to pass
to follow, to stay (on track), to go with (the times, etc.)
to take part, to participate, to join
to get into the swing (and sing, dance, etc.)
to be deceived, to be taken in
to be carried, to be spread, to be scattered
to stick, to attach, to take, to go on
switch (to another ideology, party, system, method, etc.), change, conversion
boarding (a train, bus, etc.), getting into (e.g. a taxi)
to give (someone) a ride, to give a lift, to pick up, to help on board
to load (luggage), to carry, to take on board
to send out (on the airwaves, etc.)
to deceive, to take for a ride
to publish (an article), to run (an ad)
to give one's name (as), to introduce oneself (as)
to claim to be, to call oneself, to wear the title of
to reveal oneself (as), to admit to being
to adopt as one's name, to take (a name)
to call out the goods one is selling
to climb over, to get over, to cross (a mountain)
to overcome (a difficulty, obstacle, etc.), to surmount, to get through (an illness, crisis, etc.), to get over (e.g. one's pain)
taking advantage of (an opportunity), jumping on the bandwagon
taking passage (in), getting a lift, getting a ride
to board, to embark on, to get into (a car), to man (a ship), to help (someone) into
adding (an extra amount), increasing, tacking on (a charge)
test drive, test ride, trial ride
mount, riding horse, saddle horse, horse one is riding
announcing one's name, rank, lineage, etc. (of a samurai on the battlefield)
name given to male members of the nobility and samurai class upon coming of age
Japanese kanji reading used in names
place for boarding vehicles, bus stop, bus terminal, railway platform, taxi stand, jetty, wharf
to set out, to set sail
to embark on (a new venture), to set out (to achieve something)
to weather (a storm, rough seas), to ride across, to sail across
to get through (adversity), to weather, to get over, to tide over, to overcome, to survive
to load completely (e.g. books on a shelf, people or luggage in a car)
to change (to another ideology, party, company, etc.), to switch (to a different system, method, etc.), to move on to (e.g. a new love interest)
accompanying (on a trip), escorting (a tour group)
getting on and off, embarking and disembarking
getting on and off (a vehicle), boarding and alighting
riding together, sharing a car (taxi, etc.)
backing of the same candidate by different political parties
solid, firm, stout, burly, strong, sturdy
square (of a number), multiplying (a number) by itself, second power
getting carried away, going too far, overdoing

sdata.j: ↑飛行機↑↓ひこうき↓が↑乱気流↑↓らんきりゅう↓に↑近付↑↓ちかづ↓いていたため↑操縦↑↓そうじゅう↓↑士↑↓し↓は↑乗客↑↓じょうきゃく↓にシートベルトを↑締↑↓し↓めるよう↑呼↑↓よ↓びかけた。
sdata.e: As the plane was approaching turbulence, the pilot asked the passengers aboard the plane to fasten their seat belts.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑馬↑↓うま↓に↑乗↑↓の↓る↑事↑↓こと↓が↑出来↑↓でき↓ますか。
sdata.e: Can you ride a horse?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑馬↑↓うま↓に↑乗↑↓の↓ることはできますか。
sdata.e: Can you ride a horse?

sdata.j: あなたは↑馬↑↓うま↓に↑乗↑↓の↓ることができますか。
sdata.e: Can you ride a horse?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑馬↑↓うま↓に↑乗↑↓の↓ることができない。
sdata.e: You can't ride a horse.

sdata.j: タクシーに↑乗↑↓の↓る↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓はなかったのに。
sdata.e: You needn't have taken a taxi.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑車↑↓くるま↓に↑乗↑↓の↓せてください。
sdata.e: Give me a lift in your car.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑車↑↓くるま↓に↑私↑↓わたし↓を↑乗↑↓の↓せて↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
sdata.e: Give me a lift in your car.

sdata.j: あなたを↑車↑↓くるま↓に↑乗↑↓の↓せる。
sdata.e: Give me a lift in your car.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑仕事↑↓しごと↓が↑軌道↑↓きどう↓に↑乗↑↓の↓ったら、↑値上↑↓ねあ↓げの↑話↑↓はなし↓をしましょう。
sdata.e: When your business gets rolling we'll talk about an increase.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓が↑一番乗↑↓いちばんの↓りのようだ。
sdata.e: It seems as if you are the first one here.

sdata.j: ↑空港↑↓くうこう↓リムジンバス↑乗↑↓の↓り↑場↑↓ば↓はどこですか。
sdata.e: Where can I get a shuttle bus at the airport?

sdata.j: ↑空港↑↓くうこう↓バスの↑乗↑↓の↓り↑場↑↓ば↓はどこですか。
sdata.e: Where do I get an airport bus?

sdata.j: ↑銀行↑↓ぎんこう↓のところで↑降↑↓お↓りて、↑Ａ５↑↓えいご↓２に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑換↑↓か↓えないと↑駄目↑↓だめ↓ですよ。
sdata.e: You'll have to get off at the bank and take the A52.

sdata.j: ↑銀行↑↓ぎんこう↓が↑援助↑↓えんじょ↓の↑手↑↓て↓をさしのべるのを↑拒絶↑↓きょぜつ↓したら、あなたはどうして↑資金繰↑↓しきんぐ↓りの↑危機↑↓きき↓を↑乗↑↓の↓り↑切↑↓き↓るのか。
sdata.e: How do you expect to weather the financial storm when the bank refuses to extend a helping hand?

sdata.j: ↑急行↑↓きゅうこう↓に↑乗↑↓の↓るには、↑普通↑↓ふつう↓↑券↑↓けん↓に↑加↑↓くわ↓えて↑急行↑↓きゅうこう↓↑券↑↓けん↓を↑買↑↓か↓う↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓がある。
sdata.e: To take an express train, we have to get an express ticket in addition to an ordinary ticket.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓げ、さもないと↑列車↑↓れっしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるよ。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or you will miss the train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓ぎなさい。さもないと↑列車↑↓れっしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れますよ。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or you will miss the train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓ぎなさい、そうしないと↑電車↑↓でんしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れますよ。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or you will miss the train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓げ、さもないと↑最終↑↓さいしゅう↓↑電車↑↓でんしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるぞ。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or you will be late for the last train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓ぎなさい。さもないと↑列車↑↓れっしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるでしょう。
sdata.e: You will miss the train if you don't hurry.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓ぎなさい、でないとバスに↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるよ。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or you'll miss the bus.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓ぎなさい、でないと↑列車↑↓れっしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるよ。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or we'll miss the train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓ぎなさい、そうでないと↑飛行機↑↓ひこうき↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるだろう。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or you'll miss your plane.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓ぎなさい、そうしないと↑列車↑↓れっしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れます。
sdata.e: Hurry up, or you'll miss the train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓がなければ、↑急行↑↓きゅうこう↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるぞ。
sdata.e: You must hurry up, or you will miss the express.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓がないと↑列車↑↓れっしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れますよ。
sdata.e: Hurry, or you'll miss the train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓がないと、↑電車↑↓でんしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れるよ。
sdata.e: You'll miss the train if you don't hurry.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓がないと↑電車↑↓でんしゃ↓に↑乗↑↓の↓り↑遅↑↓おく↓れますよ。
sdata.e: If you don't hurry, you'll miss the train.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓いで↑何↑↓なに↓とかバスに↑乗↑↓の↓れました。
sdata.e: I hurried and managed to catch the bus.
